intro: Hieracium vittatiflorum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and the leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium vittatiflorum is often found in temperate regions and can sometimes be considered a weed in agricultural areas.
